Platform.name: Global Ionosphere Radio Observatory
Platform.description: Global Ionosphere Radio Observatory (GIRO) is formed through data sharing agreements with 100+ ionosonde sites in 30+ countries. Ionosondes are high frequency sounding remote sensors for accurate specification of the bottomside electron density in the Earth's ionosphere. As of 2020, 61 GIRO locations provide near-real-time data to the Lowell GIRO Data Center (LGDC) in Lowell, Massachusetts. Real-time and retrospective data from GIRO locations are ingested in several LGDC databases, including Digital Ionogram DataBase (DIDBase), Ionospheric Plasma Drift DataBase (DriftBase), Global Assimilative Model of Bottomside Ionosphere with Topside Extension (GAMBIT) database, and Traveling Ionospheric Disturbances DataBase (TIDBase) GIRO data are open for public access via GIRO Web Portal, and custom software tools for ionosonde data analysis.
